Author: tlrobinson
Content:
Yeah, as far as I'm concerned, the OLPC XO is a far better device than the Kindle.

Sure it doesn't have "free" EV-DO for buying ebooks from Amazon, but it runs Linux so you can use any ebook format you want (without paying Amazon). Plus full web browsing and other (basic) desktop apps that you would expect from a low end laptop.

...For the same price as a Kindle (including a donation of a laptop to a child in a developing nation)

Author: spking
Title: The guy who's responsible for marketing the iPhone and the iPod

Author: mhb
Content: I'm surprised that no one mentions newspapers and magazines. These seem like the obvious win for the Kindle. No more dirty, bulky newspapers to carry around or dispose of.  There is no DRM issue since the content has a one day shelf life.  And the payback from a potentially lower subscription cost could justify the cost of the Kindle.  As with books, it is obviously nice for commuters.

Title: You are a bad leader when...

Author: mattmaroon
Content: I'm really hoping our fantasy sports site will be popular in the Sombrero Galaxy.

Author: nkohari
Content: I disagree. I still don't think any app that's been created really takes advantage of the Facebook platform. The toy applications are the easiest and most obvious ones to create. The real ones will come later, particularly when they start issuing fbFund grants...

Author: amichail
Content: An audio recaptcha should fix that.

Author: pixcavator
Content: Even so, you can't argue that the growth is exponential by simply looking at the graph. It could just as well be polynomial. To conclude that it is exponential you need some kind of analysis, like "every user brings two, those bring two each etc".

Author: rms
Content: Hopefully the superior screen technology of the OLPC will start trickling down to other consumer devices. The specs on the black and white OLPC screen are better than the kindle.
